sentences.sContent: Wearing a bee halo, Mark hopped over one fence, then another.
sentences.sContent_eng: Wearing a bee halo, Mark hopped over one fence, then another.
sentences.sCn: 戴着蜜蜂的光环，马克跳过一个又一个篱笆。

sentences.sContent: There is a strict halo of seriousness around science in Egypt.
sentences.sContent_eng: There is a strict halo of seriousness around science in Egypt.
sentences.sCn: 在埃及，科学被一个严肃性的严格光环包围着。

sentences.sContent: But what this experiment demonstrates is that although we can understand the halo effect intellectually, we often have no idea when it is actually happening.
sentences.sContent_eng: But what this experiment demonstrates is that although we can understand the halo effect intellectually, we often have no idea when it is actually happening.
sentences.sCn: 但是上面这个实验所证明的是，虽然我们在智力上可以理解光环效应，但是我们通常不知道它到底什么时候在起作用。

phrases.pCn: 晕轮效应；连锁反应；[心]成见效应

trans.tranOther: a bright circle that is often shown above or around the heads of holy people in religious art
